properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 11 at 8:13PM CST until February 13 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Twin Cities/Chanhassen MN
properties.description:
...BLIZZARD CONDITIONS EXPECTED IN WESTERN MINNESOTA WEDNESDAY...
...DANGEROUS WIND CHILLS EXPECTED WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH
THURSDAY MORNING...

.A Blizzard Warning remains in effect for portions of west
central and southwest Minnesota starting 6 am Wednesday morning,
and continues through the afternoon. A Winter Storm Watch with
blizzard conditions possible surround the blizzard warning in west
central, southwest and south central Minnesota for the same time
period. Wind Chill Warnings have been issued for west central
through southwestern Minnesota, with Wind Chill Advisories issued
for east central Minnesota, portions of southeast Minnesota and
far western Wisconsin for Wednesday night into Thursday morning.

Confidence has increased that portions of west central and
southwest Minnesota, mainly west of a Morris to Redwood Falls to
St. James line, will have blizzard conditions developing behind a
strong Arctic front on Wednesday. The combination of strong gusty
winds and whiteout conditions will lead to blizzard conditions
for several hours. Confidence is lower on wind speeds farther to
the east and thus a Winter Storm Watch has been issued.

Outside the warning and watch area, significant blowing and
drifting snow is likely, with locally one to two inches of snow by
the afternoon.

In addition to the blizzard conditions, temperatures will drop
off sharply behind the Arctic front. Wind chill values will drop
30 degrees below zero by the afternoon in west central Minnesota,
with wind chills likely dropping to 35 degrees below zero by the
evening, persisting through Thursday morning. In eastern
Minnesota into western Wisconsin, wind chills will drop to between
25 and 35 degrees below zero late Wednesday night through
Thursday morning. Outside the warning and watch area, significant
blowing and drifting snow is likely, with locally one to two
inches of snow by the afternoon.

* WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as
35 below zero.

* WHERE...Morrison, Mille Lacs, Benton and Wright Counties.

* WHEN...From 10 PM Wednesday to 10 AM CST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause
frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
properties.instruction:
Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM WEDNESDAY TO 10 AM CST THURSDAY
